title: What is happing in #SuezCanal today explained
brief_description: On March 23, the sight of a container ship lodged inside the Suez Canal like a car abandoned during a bad parallel park enthralled the world. But the traffic the Ever Given blocked wasn’t insignificant, with hundreds of other vessels barred from delivering supplies and the stock market affected. A catastrophe yes, but one that flooded the internet with hilarious memes, like this one from Zaina Erhaim, which married the logistical absurdity with an equally absurd and iconic scene from Austin Powers: International Man of Mystery.
description:
This video features in a responsive display in the museum that presents the moments, stories and memes capturing the zeitgeist by going viral on the internet.

On March 23, the Ever Given container ship got stuck in the Suez Canal like a car abandoned during a bad park, causing ships delivering supplies around the world to be blocked. Though a catastrophe, the internet responded with hilarious memes, like this one that married the logistical absurdity with an equally absurd scene from Austin Powers.
